Career Profile

I am a PhD student in the Soft Condensed Matter Group in the Utrecht University currently in my 4th year. My research is based on the computational study of Self-propelled nanoparticles to assist theoretical understanding of Active systems. My project is a part of the Shell-NWO/FOM Computational Sciences for Energy Research program. I’m interested in solving physics and engineering problems through numerical modelling and simulations.

Education

B. Tech. and M. Tech. in Chemical Engineering

2007 - 2012
Indian Institute of Technology Kanpur
  • Master’s Thesis on Interfacial Thermodynamics of crystal-melt system using numerical simulations.

Experiences

Executive - Conversion process

2012 - 2015
Galaxy Surfactants Ltd., Mumbai, Maharashtra

Summer trainee

May 2010 - July 2010
Eureka Forbes Ltd. R&D centre, Dehradun

Projects

A simulation study of BCC phase transformations using modified LJ potential - studied the Interfacial free energy and Polymorphism in a Lennard-Jones potential system using atomistic Monte-Carlo Simulations

Publications

Ratchet-induced variations in bulk states of an active ideal gas
J. Rodenburg, S. Paliwal, M. d. Jager, P. G. Bolhuis, M. Dijkstra and R. v. Roij
The Journal of Chemical Physics 149 (17), 174910
Chemical potential in active systems-predicting phase equilibrium from bulk equations of state?
S Paliwal, J Rodenburg, R van Roij, M Dijkstra
New Journal of Physics
Non-Equilibrium Surface Tension of the Vapour-Liquid Interface of Active Lennard-Jones Particles
